meanings.definition: Strengthen or support (an object or idea)
meanings.sent1: Practicing math problems regularly reinforces your understanding of the concepts.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reinforces good behavior by praising students who follow the rules.
meanings.sent3: Eating vegetables before dessert reinforces the idea that healthy choices come first.
meanings.sent4: Positive feedback from friends reinforces my confidence like a sturdy wall.
meanings.sent5: The image of a tree with deep roots reinforces the concept of stability.

meanings.definition: To provide additional support or encouragement
meanings.sent1: A good friend reinforces your decision to try something new.
meanings.sent2: The coach reinforces the importance of teamwork to the players.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a lucky charm reinforces the belief in good luck.
meanings.sent4: Kind words from a stranger can reinforce your faith in humanity.
meanings.sent5: A warm hug reinforces the feeling of being cared for.

meanings.definition: To make stronger or more intense
meanings.sent1: Adding spices to the dish reinforces the flavors.
meanings.sent2: The intense workout routine reinforces my determination to get fit.
meanings.sent3: Watching a scary movie at night reinforces the feeling of excitement.
meanings.sent4: The stormy weather reinforces the power of nature.
meanings.sent5: The loud applause reinforces the actor's sense of accomplishment.
